qas.question: If you started with a two-sided laminate etched on either side, laminated to the top and bottom, and processed it again to get traces on the outside layers, how many layers would your final PCB have?
What makes up the inside of a multi-layer PCB?
Pressure is one thing you need to apply to make a multi-layer PCB; what's the other thing?
What tool is used to push the trace layers in a multi-layer PCB together?
Single-layer printed circuit boards have trace layers where?

plausible_answers.text: by starting from a two-sided copper-clad laminate, etch the circuitry on both sides, then laminate to the top and bottom pre-preg and copper foil

qas.question: A five-layer PCB can be fabricated how?
What kind of circuit boards result from applying pressure and cold air for a period of time?
A silver-clad laminate can be found in what kind of circuit board?
A five-layer PCB uses what kind of foil?

context: <b6_0><b7_0>Multi-layer printed circuit boards<b7_0/><b6_0/> have <a1_0>trace layers<a1_0/> <b4_0>inside the board<b4_0/>. This is achieved by laminating a stack of materials in a <a3_0>press<a3_0/> by applying pressure and <a2_0>heat<a2_0/> for a period of time. This results in an inseparable one piece product. For example, a <a0_0>four<a0_0/>-layer PCB can be fabricated <b5_0>by starting from a two-sided copper-clad laminate, etch the circuitry on both sides, then laminate to the top and bottom pre-preg and <b8_0>copper<b8_0/> foil<b5_0/>. It is then drilled, plated, and etched again to get traces on top and bottom layers.
